    >           Course Detail                                        Writing for Late Night Television: Monologue, Jokes, Bits, and Sketches                                Semester and Year        FA 2015                    Course Number        WRTNG-UG1508                    Section        001                    Instructor        D.B. Gilles                    Days                            Mon                                 Time                            3:30 PM -       6:10 PM                                Units        4.0                    Level        U                    Foundation Requirement                                                  Description       This course introduces students to writing for the world of Late Night Television. Every talk show host has a unique voice and style. Work will include learning how to write opening monologues for  The Daily Show  , Conan O'Brien, Larry Wilmore and Jimmy Kimmel among others. Other subjects we will cover include understanding the difference between a sketch and a bit, how to structure a joke, and how to find material. Work will also involve writing sketches such as those on  Saturday Night Live  , Between Two Ferns with Zach Galifianakus, Key and Peele and we’ll examine the techniques of Upright Citizens Brigade. Students will learn how to go from idea, to building the sketch, to completing it. Writing assignments may include creating original on-going sketch characters, Jimmy Fallon Thank You Notes, fake news items ala Weekend Update and writing short film parodies ala  Funny Or Die  .
